text:
Windows XP SP2 (Home Edition) has apparently broken the Apache Web Server 
(amongst other things). The status monitor says that it is running but when I 
try to view local Web pages, IE, Netscape, Mozilla all try to load the web 
page but never do.  I tried to disable the Microsoft Firewall but it does not 
help.  

The error.log has multiple entries in it like this:
 "Sun Nov 21 18:39:43 2004] [error] (OS 10038)An operation was attempted on 
something that is not a socket.  : Child 1332: Encountered too many errors 
accepting client connections. Possible causes: dynamic address renewal, or 
incompatible VPN or firewall software. Try using the Win32DisableAcceptEx 
directive."
creator: gtbaclaus@earthlink.net
chip@force-elite.com
text:
Did you try adding 'Win32DisableAcceptEx' to your configuration file as the
error message recommended?

creator: gtbaclaus@earthlink.net
text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> Did you try adding 'Win32DisableAcceptEx' to your configuration file as the
> error message recommended?

I did but I forgot to stop and restart the Apache HTTP server. DUH!!  Now that 
I restarted it, it works fine.  

Thanks!!
